trans-unit.source: Represents a selectable item in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> contains a collection of ListBoxItem objects.
To select a ListBoxItem in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox>, set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem.IsSelected%2A> property to `true`.
Bind a ListBoxItem to data by binding the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> to a data source.
For more information, see [How to: Bind a ListBox to Data](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

You can customize the appearance of a ListBoxItem by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemTemplate%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> to a <xref:System.Windows.DataTemplate>.
For more information, see [Data Templating Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> of a ListBoxItem is set to <xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment>.
The default horizontal position of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StackPanel> is <xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment>.
If you set the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> property of a ListBoxItem through a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StackPanel>, the panel's default is applied and the item is centered.
A ListBoxItem is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>, which means that it can contain a single object of any type (such as a string, an image, or a panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> class.
Customizing the ListBoxItem Control To apply the same property settings to multiple ListBoxItem controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the ListBoxItem, see [ListBox Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in ListBoxItem control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref> is selected.
To select a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox>, set this property to `true`.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the item is selected; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem.IsSelected*> dependency property.
To be added.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ListBoxItemAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] automation infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Called when the mouse enters a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
The event data.
Called when the mouse leaves a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
The event data.
Called when the user presses the right mouse button over the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
The event data.
Called when the user presses the right mouse button over a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
The event data.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref> is selected in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref>.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem.IsSelected%2A> property changes to `true`.
The event data.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref> is unselected in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBox"></xref>.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem.IsSelected%2A> property changes to `false`.
The event data.
Called when the visual parent of a list box item changes.
The previous <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Parent*> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref>.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref> is selected.
To know when the selection in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> changes, listen for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectionChanged> event.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||

Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem.Selected"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem"></xref> is unselected.
To know when the selection in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> changes, listen for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectionChanged> event.
